content: You're asking to sort in alphabetic order, but many of the comparisons involve comparing - with x, which isn't really defined. Not to mention digits.

There seems to be a small problem with this line from the instructions:
If the white rook is in e4 and can capture an opponent piece in e3, then the output must contain Re3xe4

Shouldn't it be Re4xe3?

Nice puzzle!
A few issues:
* In Output: "action is meant to be" -> "action should be"
* In Output: "Moves must be sort" -> "Moves must be sorted"
* Validator "CLOSE TO THE EDGE 2" - the input is invalid (only one line, the number of pieces is missing)
* The example doesn't include pieces (number of pieces is 0). This makes sense, as this is the basic case. However, I do think you should have pieces in the example, so that the input format for them is more clear.
Hey ! Thanks for the feedback ! I fixed the points you noticed, do not hesitate if there is anything disturbing
You're absolutely right, my bad, it's fixed now. Thank you !
Never mind, I just edited to something that made sense to me.
thank you for the fix, couldn't see your message at the time but this is very helpful since I did not think about it when I first wrote the puzzle

Great. But now the name of the first test (FREEEEEE ROOOOK) doesn't fit the test anymore (since there are other pieces on the board, so the rook isn't free). Also, the matching validator doesn't really match the test (they should be pretty similar in idea).
Maybe add in addition a test+validator pair for a free rook.

I edited the first test and the matching validator so that the name and the context of the test is about moving freely on the chessboard despite some units being around. Do you feel I should also add a test with 0 unit beside the rook ? I did add it at the beginning because I thought it was some kind of a test people would find in any puzzle but at the time I didn't pay attention to the fact the very first test+validator is the shown example
I don't think a test with 0 pieces is necessary.
